jparsec.io

Class FileIO

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.io.FileIO

  • public class FileIO
extends java.lang.Object
    Miscellaneous utility functions for file I/O.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)

      • getPath

        public static java.lang.String getPath(boolean clean)
        Obtains path of the working directory.
        Parameters:
        clean - True to remove file:/ from the beginning of the output string. True recommended since it depends on the operating system.
        Returns:
        Full path.

      • getFiles

        public static java.lang.String[] getFiles(java.lang.String path)
                                   throws JPARSECException
        To obtain a list of all files available in certain path. Files are usually sorted by name, but this is not guaranteed.
        Parameters:
        path - A directory path.
        Returns:
        List of files.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getFilesByDate

        public static java.lang.String[] getFilesByDate(java.lang.String path,
                                boolean recentFilesFirst)
                                         throws JPARSECException
        To obtain a list of all files available in certain path, ordered by date.
        Parameters:
        path - A directory path.
        recentFilesFirst - True to return the most recent file in the first index of the array, false to return the most recent file at the end of the array.
        Returns:
        List of files.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getLastField

        public static java.lang.String getLastField(java.lang.String arg,
                            java.lang.String separator,
                            boolean skip)
        Get last field of a string. Fields are supposed to be separated by a string called separator.
        Parameters:
        arg - String with fields.
        separator - String that defines the separator.
        skip - True to skip several consecutive separators.
        Returns:
        The field in the desired position number.

      • getField

        public static java.lang.String getField(int field,
                        java.lang.String text,
                        java.lang.String separator,
                        boolean skip)
        Get certain field of a string. Fields are supposed to be separated by a string called separator. If the separator is a blank space or tab several consecutive separators can be treated as one separator only if skip is set to true, which is the default value for other methods in the library.
        Parameters:
        field - Number of field. 1, 2, ...
        text - String with fields.
        separator - String that defines the separator.
        skip - True to consider several consecutive separators as one only if separator is one or several blank spaces. False has 50% better performance in this case.
        Returns:
        The field in the desired position number.

      • getNumberOfFields

        public static int getNumberOfFields(java.lang.String arg,
                    java.lang.String separator,
                    boolean skip)
        Returns the number of fields in the argument.
        Parameters:
        arg - String with fields.
        separator - String that defines the separator.
        skip - True to skip several consecutive separators.
        Returns:
        The number of fields in the string.

      • getRestAfterField

        public static java.lang.String getRestAfterField(int field,
                                 java.lang.String text,
                                 java.lang.String separator,
                                 boolean skip)
        Reads contents after certain field in a formatted line with fields separated by some separator.
        Parameters:
        field - Field number: 1, 2, ...
        text - Formatted string
        separator - Separator string.
        skip - True to skip several consecutive separators.
        Returns:
        The desired field.

      • getTextBeforeField

        public static java.lang.String getTextBeforeField(int field,
                                  java.lang.String text,
                                  java.lang.String separator,
                                  boolean skip)
        Reads contents before certain field in a formatted line with fields separated by some separator.
        Parameters:
        field - Field number: 2, 3, ...
        text - Formatted string
        separator - Separator string.
        skip - True to skip several consecutive separators.
        Returns:
        The desired fields before the given one.

      • directoryChooser

        public static java.lang.String directoryChooser(java.lang.String initialPath,
                                boolean open)
                                         throws JPARSECException
        Selects a directory using the default graphical interface.
        Parameters:
        initialPath - Initial path to start search. Can be null.
        open - True to show an open dialog, false for a save dialog.
        Returns:
        Directory path. Null if cancel is pressed.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • fileChooser

        public static java.lang.String fileChooser(boolean open)
                                    throws JPARSECException
        Selects a file/directory using the default graphical interface.
        Parameters:
        open - True to show an open dialog, false for a save dialog.
        Returns:
        File path. Null if cancel is pressed.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • fileChooser

        public static java.lang.String fileChooser(java.lang.String fileFilter,
                           java.lang.String initialPath,
                           boolean open)
                                    throws JPARSECException
        Selects a file using the default graphical interface and a file filter.
        Parameters:
        fileFilter - Extension of the files. Can be null.
        initialPath - Initial path to start search. Can be null.
        open - True to show an open dialog, false for a save dialog.
        Returns:
        File path. Null if cancel is pressed.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • deleteFile

        public static void deleteFile(java.lang.String path)
                       throws JPARSECException
        Deletes a file or directory.
        Parameters:
        path - Path of the file/directory to delete.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If the file/directory cannot be deleted, for example because it contains protected/opened files/subdirectories.

      • createDirectory

        public static boolean createDirectory(java.lang.String path)
        Create a given directory.
        Parameters:
        path - Path of the directory.
        Returns:
        True if the directory is correctly created, false otherwise.

      • createDirectories

        public static boolean createDirectories(java.lang.String path)
        Create a given directory and all necessary parent directories.
        Parameters:
        path - Path of the directory.
        Returns:
        True if the directories are correctly created, false otherwise.

      • setField

        public static java.lang.String setField(int field,
                        java.lang.String row,
                        java.lang.String separator,
                        java.lang.String value)
        Sets a field to a given value.
        Parameters:
        field - The field position, starting from 1.
        row - The set of fields.
        separator - The field separator.
        value - The value.
        Returns:
        The new set of fields.

      • getLastModifiedTimeOfResource

        public static long getLastModifiedTimeOfResource(java.lang.String jarFile,
                                 java.lang.String jarPath,
                                 java.lang.String fileName)
        Returns the time a given resource was modified for the last time.
        Parameters:
        jarFile - The name of the .jar file in the lib subdirectory (same directory as jparsec.jar), without extension.
        jarPath - The path to a given given directory inside the .jar file.
        fileName - The name of the a file inside that .jar and directory.
        Returns:
        Last modified time of the file inside the .jar, given as milliseconds from 1970 January 1 at 0h UTC, or -1 if an error occurs.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Test program.
        Parameters:
        args - Not used.

      • eliminateLeadingZeros

        public static java.lang.String eliminateLeadingZeros(java.lang.String value,
                                     boolean keepLast)
        Eliminates leading 0 from a given input string.
        Parameters:
        value - The string value.
        keepLast - True to keep last 0 before a decimal point.
        Returns:
        Same value without any leading 0's.
